---


Adding a media query for larger screens to ensure H1 stays at 32px:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/static/css/style.css</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 19, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -1154,4 +1154,23 @@
      pointer-events: none;
  }
+ 
+ /* Ensure H1 stays at 32px on all screen sizes */
+ @media (min-width: 1025px) {
+     h1 {
+         font-size: 32px !important;
+     }
+     
+     .article-header h1 {
+         font-size: 32px !important;
+     }
+     
+     .list-header h1 {
+         font-size: 32px !important;
+     }
+     
+     .hero-placeholder h1 {
+         font-size: 32px !important;
+     }
+ }
  
  /* Responsive Design */
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---



---


Updated the CSS to keep H1 at 32px on all screen sizes. Changes:

1. Added `!important` to the base `h1` rule to prevent overrides
2. Added `!important` to specific H1 selectors (`.article-header h1`, `.list-header h1`, `.hero-placeholder h1`)
3. Added a min-width media query for screens larger than 1024px to explicitly set H1 to 32px

H1 should now be 32px on all screen sizes, including large screens. The `!important` flags and the explicit media query prevent any scaling that was making it 42px on larger screens.

Updated all H2 and H3 elements to 28px on all screen sizes. Changes:

1. **Added a base `h3` rule** set to 28px
2. **Updated `.post-content h3`** from 20px to 28px
3. **Updated `.article-content h3`** from 26px to 28px
4. **Added `!important`** to all H2 and H3 font-size declarations to prevent overrides
5. **Added explicit rules in the large screen media query** (min-width: 1025px) to ensure they stay at 28px
6. **Updated the mobile media query** to include H3 rules and ensure consistency

All H2 and H3 headings are now 28px across all screen sizes, matching the H1 size consistency.
